name: AI-Driven Trial Design Optimizer
purpose: Reduce Phase II protocol amendments by using machine-learning simulations to pre-validate eligibility and endpoints.

risks.description: Regulatory acceptance of simulated arms may lag.
risks.mitigation: Early FDA/EMA consultation; publish validation white paper.

risks.description: Insufficient historical trial data to train robust simulation models.
risks.mitigation: License external datasets; use data-augmentation techniques.

risks.description: Key SME attrition during critical algorithm-tuning sprint.
risks.mitigation: Implement knowledge-transfer sessions; engage backup consultants.

achievements.summary: Prototype cut protocol-cycle time by 18 days in lymphoma use-case.
Achieved 0.91 AUC predicting amendment likelihood on 220 legacy trials.
Secured cross-functional endorsement from Biostats and Clin Dev at steering-committee review.

deliverables.description: MVP software package and user guide
Integration APIs for EDC / protocol-authoring tools
